channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Korea President Yoon Is Detained for Questioning Over Martial Law
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol became the first South Korean leader to be held by criminal investigators, ending a long standoff after he imposed martial law.

item.title: Canada CEOs scolded in spat with Trump Administration: ‘You’re not serious people’
item.description: Also: SEC sues Elon over Twitter stock purchases, JPMorgan employees consider unionizing.

item.title: Capital One sued by CFPB alleging bank cheated customers out of $2 billion in interest payments
item.description: Capital One said that it strongly disagreed with the CFPB's allegations and plans to “vigorously defend” itself in court.

item.title: South Korea President Yoon Is Detained for Questioning Over Martial Law
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol became the first South Korean leader to be held by criminal investigators, ending a long standoff after he imposed martial law.

item.title: Israel and Hamas Work on Final Details of Gaza Cease-Fire Deal, Officials Say
item.description: Negotiators and mediators meeting in Qatar were trying to address outstanding issues on Wednesday.

item.title: Mozambique Is at a Crossroads as a New President Is Sworn In
item.description: The country has been roiled by political chaos since the October election, which led to widespread demonstrations and a deadly response by the police.

item.title: Israel and Hamas Work on Final Details of Gaza Cease-Fire Deal, Officials Say
item.description: Negotiators and mediators meeting in Qatar were trying to address outstanding issues on Wednesday.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg will cohost a Trump inauguration reception along with Republican billionaires
item.description: The other cohosts include Miriam Adelson, the Dallas Mavericks owner and widow of casino magnate Sheldon Adelson; and Tilman Fertitta, casino magnate,...

item.title: Stellantis exec says European carmaker was ‘anti-American’ when it messed with customers’ ‘freedom of choice’
item.description: Newly installed Ram CEO, Tim Kuniskis, says removing its Hemi-V8 engine made Americans feel like their freedom was being taken away.

item.title: Hun Sen Adviser Wanted in Thailand Over Lim Kimya Killing
item.description: The Thai authorities accused an adviser to Hun Sen of hiring the gunman who killed a former Cambodian opposition figure in Bangkok last week.

item.title: Many Syrians Want Justice for Regime Crimes. Others Want Revenge.
item.description: The new interim Syrian government says it will hunt down and punish senior security officials and others, but concern is growing about attacks on form...

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire ‘Right on the Brink,’ and the S.E.C. Sues Elon Musk
Choice for Energy Secretary Has Been an Evangelist for Fossil Fuels
item.description: Chris Wright, the founder of a fracking services company, argues that oil and gas are key to alleviating global poverty.

item.title: Biden signs AI order to allow energy resources to be built quickly for data centers, which could use up to 12% of U.S. electricity by 2028
item.description: Biden said the efforts are designed to accelerate the clean energy transition in a way that is “responsible and respectful to local communities” and d...
